description.value:
Yan-C-Bin makes two slam attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 3d8 + @mod + 3 type=force average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 3d6 type=lightning average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Yan-C- Bin unleashes a terrible thundercrack in a 100-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} centered on himself. All other creatures in the area must succeed on a [[/save con 24 format=long]] or take [[/damage 9d6 type=thunder average=true]] damage and be &Reference[deafened]{deafened} for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is &Reference[deafened]{deafened} until the start of Yan-C-Bin’s next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

monsterMunch.titleHTML: Thundercrack (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).
monsterMunch.fullName: Thundercrack (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest).

description.value:
Yan-C-Bin polymorphs into a Medium &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid}. While in polymorphed form, a swirling breeze surrounds him, his eyes are pale and cloudy, and he loses the Air Form trait. He can remain in polymorphed form for up to 1 hour. Reverting to his true form requires an action.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Yan-C-Bin summons up to three air elemental;air elementals and loses 30 hit points for each &Reference[elemental]{elemental} he summons. Summoned elementals have maximum hit points, appear within 100 feet of Yan-C-Bin, and disappear if Yan-C-Bin is reduced to 0 hit points.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Lair Actions

On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Yan-C-Bin takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; he can’t use the same effect two rounds in a row:

  • Yan-C-Bin drops the temperature of the air, covering all surfaces with ice. This effect is identical to the sleet storm spell.
  • Yan-C-Bin controls the surrounding air as an extension of himself. Each creature Yan-C-Bin designates must succeed at a [[/save con 24 format=long]] or be hoisted or flung 3d6 × 10 feet through the air. A creature smashed into a solid object or released in mid-air takes 1d[[/damage 6 bludgeoning average=false]] damage for every 10 feet moved or fallen.
  • Yan-C-Bin creates a torrent of debris within 120 feet of him that lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round. The debris lightly obscures every creature and object in the area for the duration. All creatures in the area must succeed at a [[/save wis 24 format=long]] or be &Reference[blinded]{blinded} until initiative count 20 on the next round.
The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Regional Effects

When Yan-C-Bin inhabits an &Reference[elemental]{elemental} node, the air is at his command. Temperatures fluctuate from blistering hot to freezing cold; &Reference[thunder]{thunder} rolls and &Reference[lightning]{lightning} cracks; powerful gales bear heavy creatures and objects aloft and hurl them with incredible force; cyclones touch down randomly, obliterating whatever they touch.

  • Gale &Reference[force]{force} winds tear across the landscape in a 5-mile radius, whisking away small or light objects, dismantling roofs and fences, tearing branches from trees, and making flight impossible. Small and Medium creatures move at half speed through the wind; Tiny creatures exposed to the wind are carried away with it at a rate of 40 feet per round unless they succeed at a DC 15 &Reference[str]{Strength} (&Reference[ath]{Athletics}) check.
  • Thunderstorms erupt in a 5-mile radius centered on Yan-C-Bin’s lair, creating deafening cracks of &Reference[thunder]{thunder} and constant &Reference[lightning]{lightning}. Every ten minutes the storm rages, creatures standing beneath the open sky have a five percent chance of being struck by &Reference[lightning]{lightning}. A creature struck by &Reference[lightning]{lightning} must make a [[/save con 21 format=long]], taking [[/damage 6d6 type=lightning average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
  • Cyclones touch down within a 5-mile radius of Yan-C-Bin’s lair. Every hour, there is a five percent chance that characters in this area are caught in the path of a cyclone moving 250 feet per round. Each character must succeed on a [[/save con 21 format=long]] or take [[/damage 6d6 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage. Wooden or flimsy structures in the path of the cyclone are destroyed.
  • Natural caverns and windblown canyons within 1 mile of the lair form intermittent portals to the &Reference[elemental]{Elemental} Plane of Air, allowing &Reference[elemental]{elemental} creatures into the mortal world to dwell near those locations.

If Yan-C-Bin is destroyed or banished back to his home plane, the regional effects fade over the next 1d10 days.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Yan-C-Bin’s Lair


Yan-C-Bin dwells in a palace of air on the &Reference[elemental]{Elemental} Plane of Air. In his palace and in air nodes on the &Reference[material]{Material} Plane (including the Howling Caves, described in chapter 5), Yan-C-Bin is master. He can use the following actions in his lair.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Yan-C-Bin can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. Yan-C-Bin regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

Peal of &Reference[thunder]{Thunder}. Yan-C-Bin unleashes a peal of &Reference[thunder]{thunder} that can be heard out to a range of 300 feet. Each creature within 30 feet of Yan-C-Bin takes [[/damage 1d10 type=thunder average=true]] damage.

Teleport (Costs 2 Actions). Yan-C-Bin magically teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. Anything Yan-C-Bin is wearing or carrying is teleported with him.

Suffocate (Costs 3 Actions). Yan-C-Bin steals the air of one breathing creature he can see within 60 feet of him. The target must make a [[/save con 21 format=long]]. On a failed save, the target drops to 0 hit points and is dying. On a successful save, the target can’t breathe or speak until the start of its next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Yan-C-Bin unleashes a peal of &Reference[thunder]{thunder} that can be heard out to a range of 300 feet. Each creature within 30 feet of Yan-C-Bin takes [[/damage 1d10 type=thunder average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Yan-C-Bin magically teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. Anything Yan-C-Bin is wearing or carrying is teleported with him.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Yan-C-Bin steals the air of one breathing creature he can see within 60 feet of him. The target must make a [[/save con 21 format=long]]. On a failed save, the target drops to 0 hit points and is dying. On a successful save, the target can’t breathe or speak until the start of its next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Air Form. Yan-C-Bin can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. He can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing if air could pass through that space.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Empowered Attacks. Yan-C-Bin’s slam attacks are treated as magical for the purpose of bypassing resistance and immunity to nonmagical weapons.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Innate Spellcasting. Yan-C-Bin’s innate spellcasting ability is &Reference[cha]{Charisma} (spell save DC 20, +12 to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components:

At will: gust of wind, invisibility, &Reference[lightning]{lightning} bolt

2/day each: chain &Reference[lightning]{lightning}, cloudkill, haste

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If Yan-C-Bin fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Magic Resistance. Yan-C-Bin has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

A &Reference[line]{line} of strong wind 60 feet long and 10 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose for the spell's duration. Each creature that starts its turn in the &Reference[line]{line} must succeed on a &Reference[str]{Strength} saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you in a direction following the &Reference[line]{line}.

Any creature in the &Reference[line]{line} must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving closer to you.

The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50 percent chance to extinguish them.

As a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends, you can change the direction in which the &Reference[line]{line} blasts from you.

A creature you touch becomes &Reference[invisible]{invisible} until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is &Reference[invisible]{invisible} as long as it is on the target's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

A stroke of &Reference[lightning]{lightning} forming a &Reference[line]{line} 100 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the &Reference[line]{line} must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. A creature takes 8d6 &Reference[lightning]{lightning} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The &Reference[lightning]{lightning} ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

You create a bolt of &Reference[lightning]{lightning} that arcs toward a target of your choice that you can see within range. Three bolts then leap from that target to as many as three other targets, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and can be targeted by only one of the bolts.

A target must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. The target takes 10d8 &Reference[lightning]{lightning} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, one additional bolt leaps from the first target to another target for each slot level above 6th.

You create a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} of poisonous, yellow-green fog centered on a point you choose within range. The fog spreads around corners. It lasts for the duration or until strong wind disperses the fog, ending the spell. Its area is heavily obscured.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. The creature takes 5d8 &Reference[poison]{poison} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures are affected even if they hold their breath or don't need to breathe.

The fog moves 10 feet away from you at the start of each of your turns, rolling along the surface of the ground. The vapors, being heavier than air, sink to the lowest level of the land, even pouring down openings.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, the target’s speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, it has advantage on &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throws, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.

When the spell ends, the target can’t move or take actions until after its next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it.
